Commit messages

In my travels across the Internet, I frequently find myself peaking into the code bases of websites I come across. If I‚Äôm lucky, it‚Äôs code I understand and that I can use for my own project. If I‚Äôm even luckier, the person who wrote the code leaves a funny trail of the experience they had writing the code.

When I‚Äôm working with a new framework or programming language, I sometimes feel isolated and silly for not knowing how one thing or another might work. Reading these commit messages makes me feel better about the state of the world.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She has a keen interest in (digital) humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking.
